TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event of a or a .

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AudioLevel As Integer
public: property int AudioLevel { int get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the audio level associated with the event.
Docs.value: The level of audio input when the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event was raised.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AudioPosition As TimeSpan
public: property TimeSpan AudioPosition { TimeSpan get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the position in the input device's audio stream that indicates where the problem occurred.
Docs.value: The position in the input device's audio stream when the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event was raised.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.AudioPosition%2A> property references the input device's position in its generated audio stream. By contrast, the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.RecognizerAudioPosition%2A> property references the recognizer's position within its audio input. These positions can be different. For more information, see [Using Speech Recognition Events](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01c598ca-2e0e-4e89-b303-cd1cef9e8482).

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property AudioSignalProblem As AudioSignalProblem

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.value: The audio signal problem that caused the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event to be raised.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property RecognizerAudioPosition As TimeSpan
public: property TimeSpan RecognizerAudioPosition { TimeSpan get(); };

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets the position in the audio input that the recognizer has received that indicates where the problem occurred.
Docs.value: The position in the audio input that the recognizer has received when the AudioSignalProblemOccurred event was raised.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.AudioPosition%2A> property references the input device's position in its generated audio stream. By contrast, the <xref:System.Speech.Recognition.AudioSignalProblemOccurredEventArgs.RecognizerAudioPosition%2A> property references the recognizer's position within its audio input. These positions can be different. For more information, see [Using Speech Recognition Events](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/01c598ca-2e0e-4e89-b303-cd1cef9e8482).
